    • Constructor Detail

      • RaiderDrive

        public RaiderDrive​(CubicDeadband speedDeadband,
                   CubicDeadband turnDeadband)
        Create a RaiderDrive object. RaiderDrive contains methods used by 5024 to convert joystick data to motor outputs. This includes our movement smoothing system.
        Parameters:
        speedDeadband - Deadband / modifier for forward-backward movement
        turnDeadband - Deadband / modifier for rotational movement

    • Method Detail

      • setRampRate

        public void setRampRate​(double rate)
        Change the movement smoothing ramp rate
        Parameters:
        rate - Maximum change in speed allowed

      • normalize

        public DriveSignal normalize​(DriveSignal signal)

      • computeArcade

        public DriveSignal computeArcade​(double speed,
                                 double rotation)
        Compute motor outputs in a similar way to WPILib's ArcadeDrive
        Parameters:
        speed - Desired robot speed (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        rotation - Desired turning rate (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        Returns:
        DriveSignal Motor outputs

      • computeConstCurve

        public DriveSignal computeConstCurve​(double speed,
                                     double rotation)
        Compute motor outputs with a constant-curvature drive method. This results in a very similar feel to 254's robots. The robot will drive like a car (and cannot turn in place)
        Parameters:
        speed - Desired robot speed (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        rotation - Movement path curvature amount (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        Returns:
        DriveSignal Motor outputs

      • computeSemiConst

        public DriveSignal computeSemiConst​(double speed,
                                    double rotation,
                                    boolean enableDeadband)
        Compute semi-constant-curvature drive. This will give the feel of a constant-curvature drive, without removing the robot's ability to turn on the spot
        Parameters:
        speed - Desired robot speed (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        rotation - Movement path curvature amount (in percentage from -1 to 1)
        enableDeadband - Should the CubicDeadband be enabled?
        Returns:
        DriveSignal Motor output

      • reset

        public void reset()
